V1: After a quick skim of the article it looks like this is hindcasting of herring from the 1930's
V9: i don't think that number of fish caught is necessarily biogeochemical or organismal, but its related to population
V13: validated on near-term, out of sample data

V1: ok, this is a hard one. While they are technically producing a forecast using data from the past, it is from the 1930s and so a lot of the questions we would be interested in for the matrix do not apply (e.g. cyberinfrastructure, uncertainty, even forecast assessment metricx). I don't think this one should be included personally. Abby: I am going to include it for now because it seems to meet our criteria
V7: sort of? It does a regression using previous months. Not our typical image of a forecast, but I think it counts as a hindcast
V10: yes; hindcasts/simulations using forecasted met as drivers
V16: forecast for two projected scenarios (2015 and 2027) - could be both near-term and long-term
